Start: ^Max asked me to meet them to talk about
^Plus, after skipping breakfast I feel like getting some grub.
^Max is sitting at a table in the middle of the room.
^I fill up my plate up and sit down to join them.
^] "So, uh... what was that thing you wanted to talk about?"
^[Max] "Straight to business! That would be the `exit survey`."
^"Sunflower House collects data on all outgoing residents in order to improve."
^"You can opt out, but I'd appreciate it if you could answer a few questions about your time here."

c: ^] "Uh... I'm gonna have to give that a pass."
^Max gives me a disappointed look. How rare.
^"If you change your mind, I'll be around!"

g-0: ^"I need to go check on something. I'll be back soon."

HappyStart: ^Timothy walks in, more confident than I've seen him in a while.
^[Dyed>Timothy] "I-I'm g-going to go get some food, And I'll be right back."
^Timothy scuttles off to the kitchen proper. @Not two seconds later, I hear a familiarly loud voice from down the hallway.

g-0: ^[Max] "Again? You two really need to sort out your sleep schedules!"
^Max seems to have also joined in, likely having overheard Eduardo's hard-to-miss voice.
^[Charlotte] "Really now. If either of you require assistance in making a schedule, you have only to ask."
^In an instant, the table I was sitting at was surrounded by the people I know, laughing.
^It's... odd.<delay=0.5>@ Almost like we're a big happy family.
^The only thing missing is Timothy, who walks back in with his food, surprised by the sudden flood of people.

c: ^I watch Timothy, as he seems to debate with himself to approach us.

g-1: ^Timothy hesitates for a second, before approaching the group.
^Everyone else gets drawn to Timothy's crackling, yet boastful utterance.
^All eyes are on Timothy, and starts to shrivel slightly.
^[Eduardo] "Yo! Timothy, my man, You look awesome."
^[Trissa] "Oh yeah! That color really suits you."
^[Charlotte] "I must say, your immediate presence seems much bolder, and more relaxed than I've seen you."
^Timothy's smile grows with every complement he gets. He looks to Max, the only one who hasn't said anything.
^"I think you look happier than I've ever seen you! and that's the best thing I could see."
^"I-I probably w-wouldn't have been able to, i-i-if
^, You've got my thanks, as well as Timothy's, no doubt."
^Max gives a hearty laugh, before quickly turning their mop on me like it was a sword.
^"You didn't make a mess of your bathroom on your last day, now did you?"

c: ^"Well, it’s your last day, plus I can't be mad you made Timothy that happy, so I'll let it slide."

g-2: ^It's times like now I really begin to question if Max is the first floor's RA, or janitor.
^Timothy sits with us, and we have a lively group conversion.
^Well, really, its mostly Eduardo and Trissa talking, with everyone else interjecting periodically, but still.
^Time, however, moves ever onward, and the conversation dies down.
^I excuse myself first, and head off to my next location...

SadStart: ^I spot Timothy sitting at one of the tables alone.
^I sit myself down with my meal.

s0: ^He seems to be in a quiet mood today.
s1: ^He's quiet again. Am I too late to help him?

s0: ^I silently eat with him for a while until I hear a loud voice approach.
s1: ^I search for something to say to break the silence. Anything. But before I find the words, a loud voice approaches.

g-0: ^[Max] "Again? You two really need to sort out your sleep schedules!"
^[Charlotte] "If either of you require assistance in making a schedule, you have only to ask."
^Eduardo throws his arms in the air in surrender. A smile cracks Isaac's stoney facade.

s0: ^I can't help but chuckle a bit, too.
s1: ^I can't laugh at a time like this.

s0: ^... different... from what my life has been these past many years

s1: ^I can't believe I was naive enough to think

Breakdown: ^Timothy stays quiet, But Eduardo doesn't seem to notice.

g-0: ^Timothy doesn't respond. I turn to face him.
^He doesn't seem to be looking at anything in particular and he's visibly shaking slightly.
^Timothy looks vaguely in my direction and outstretches his hand.
^His hand clasps onto my arm with the shaky, ironclad grip of desperation. I feel his racing heartbeat through his palm.
^His lips move as if trying to speak, but no words escape them.
^With his free hand he clutches onto his shirt.
^No one seems to hear my weak call over the chatter and laughter.

b: ^my voice fails to break over the chatter.
^I need to speak up more, but...
^I can't get their attention this way.
^I'm going to need to move over there, and grab them.
^in an instant, Max drops their carefree attitude, seeing Timothy in distress.
^] "I think he's having a panic attack."
^[Max] "Hey, Timothy. I "m here. whatever's happening, I'm here to help."
^"there's nothing to be afraid of. your safe here."
^I feel Timothy's grip on my arm loosen, as his breath finally breaks into a stuttering inhale.
^"There there. It's okay. just breath. just breath"
^As Timothy begins to breathe again, the tears begin to flow. @He's balling up a storm.
^[Max] "hehe, Its okay. you've done nothing wrong."
^"We don't have to stay here if you don't want to."
^He nods his head, and Max quickly walks Timothy out of the cafe to a more comfortable place.

ForcefulAssistence: ^I begin to move over to get Max, but I'm pulled back by Timothy's grip.
^His grip tightens, as his eyes begin to water. @I can't leave Timothy here.
BreakPoint: ^I... I don't know what to do. @I... I can't do anything!
^I try to get up, and get Max. @@To get away from all of this.
^I Pull my arm, to try and free it from Timothy's Vice-like grip, but to no avail.
^He doesn't seem to want to let go.
^To free myself, I pry my finger's underneath his palm, and peel his finger's off me.
^I free my hand, and jump up out of my seat, leaving Timothy where he sat.
^] "It's Timothy. He-He's acting weird, and not responding. I-I think something wrong!"
^Max darts past me to where Timothy is sitting in a speed quite frightening for someone their size.
HowDoIComfort: ^I choose to stay beside Timothy, and attempt to help him through this.

b: ^"Um, uh... It... it’s Okay. Calm down Timothy. Relax. it's going to be okay. uh-uh."
^Timothy doesn't respond to my words, only giving a sharp inhale.
^I... I don't know what I'm doing.
^I'm not going to be capable of helping Timothy.
^I have no idea what I'm supposed to do. If there is anything to do.
^I need to get Max. They're actually trained to handle this kind of situation.
^"Its okay Timothy. You're going to be okay."
^I put my not-griped hand on his hand, and get him to look at me.
^"Its okay. Your safe. I'm here for you."
^"It's okay, you can breathe. there there."
^and like that, the floodgates open. He exhales a sputter of air, as tears fall across his face.
^] "It's okay. let it out. Your safe here. it’s okay."
^as if by magic, Max appears beside me. I guess they noticed what had been happening over hear.
^[Max] "Do you want to go someplace quiet?"
^Timothy nods through the tears and shivering.
^Max takes his hands, and begins to take Timothy away. We share a glance, as I feel like they're thanking me.
^And like that, Max and Timothy left the cafe.

MoodKiller: ^My attention draws back to crowd of people around me.
^[Charlotte] "It was a rather humorous endeavor. hm?"
^[Eduardo] "Daaaaaaaaaang man. Timothy just lost his sh-"
^Isaac jabs his boyfriend in the gut.
^Isaac drags Eduardo out of the cafe in a huff.
^"Well. I'm out. See you at dinner."

g-0: ^I slump, as I get up out of my chair, and towards the door.
^[Charlotte] "But, what do you mean by that?"
